title.value: Improving day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting by Leveraging Spatio-Temporal Context
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Improving day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting by Leveraging Spatio-Temporal Context

extractions.description: The paper investigates day-ahead solar irradiance forecasting by leveraging spatio-temporal context from satellite data. It introduces CrossViViT, a novel deep learning architecture that combines satellite imagery and time series data to make highly accurate predictions of solar irradiance at various stations. The study also emphasizes the importance of considering cloud cover for reliable forecasting and proposes a unique testing scheme to evaluate model performance in challenging scenarios.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results and benchmarks the proposed deep learning models against other models on specific datasets, validating their effectiveness in forecasting solar irradiance.
type.quote: We experimentally show that the proposed approach can generalize to a new station not seen during training in a zero-shot generalization forecasting setting.

name.justification: The paper utilizes advanced deep learning methods, including transformers and multi-modal architectures, to enhance the accuracy of solar irradiance forecasting.
name.quote: In this paper, we put forth a deep learning architecture designed to harness spatio-temporal context using satellite data, to attain highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting for any given station.

name.justification: The main objective of the research is to improve time series forecasting of solar irradiance using deep learning models that incorporate spatio-temporal context.
name.quote: We present a deep learning architecture called CrossViViT, designed to leverage spatio-temporal context (such as satellite data) in order to achieve highly accurate medium-term (1 day horizon) time-series forecasting at any given station.
